instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Good morning, this mac had an oxidation in the <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> on pins 4,5 and 6, it replaces, but there was no result.
   I removed <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR>. I checked the termials and components of the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>. I tested another BIOS ME clean. 
   L7630 0v, ALL_ SYS when you connect the MagSafe it pulses 3.3 twice, then it stays 0V.

Voltage: ppbus 12.6V; pp3v42 3.42V; <SIGNAL>PM_SL4</SIGNAL> 0v, pulse; Vcore 0V, pulse.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Did you put back all the components?
<TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> can be kept out, not really needed.

Oxidation at <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> could damaged PCH/CPU.
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> pulsing too?
Test starting in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: In SMC bypass mode, the fan rotates and stops when it drives <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 0V, pulses sometimes.
What tests can I do to identify PCH or CPU are in defect?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
PCH/CPU is the same; both in one die.
Check for more corrosion on the board.
Heat CPU with quality flux.
